article_title: Census Bureau Confirms How Badly Obamacare Is Underperforming

article_metadata.description: The latest Census figures show that there were 8.5 million fewer uninsured in 2014 compared to 2013. This is much lower than previously-reported gains in coverage from various sources. But it also is far below official government predictions of the reduction in uninsured that would occur due to Obamacare. We won't know for certain until Fall 2016 how many additional Americans may have gained coverage in calendar 2015. But if has become increasingly obvious that Obamacare is falling short of its coverage goals, that fact, in conjunction with news of a massive increase in premiums for 2017 is likely to make 2016 yet another year in which this misguided law severely punishes the Democrats who support it on Election Day.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
